alert.note: Alert for Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 05 at 8:45PM PST until December 07 at 4:04PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai and Shoshone and Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Until 400 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 PM PST, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated significant rainfall over the northern Idaho Panhandle and the mountainous terrain of northeast Washington. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The rain on top of melting snow will lead to flooding in areas that drain poorly as well as rises on creeks and small streams. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Mud and rockslides in steep terrain will be a potential impact as the soil becomes increasingly saturated. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coeur d`Alene, Post Falls, Hayden, Sandpoint, Rathdrum, Bonners Ferry, Dalton Gardens, Kellogg, Priest River, Pinehurst, Osburn, Wallace, Colville, Chewelah, Newport, Spirit Lake, Ponderay, Moyie Springs, Athol and Mullan. - Colville River, Pack River, Pink Creek, Nine Mile Creek, and Lightning Creek - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
